DOC.detailed_description: Objectives : The purpose research study test effectiveness new multimodal educational intervention improve caregiver competence create safer home environment , decrease risk accident veteran dementia live community . Objective 1 : To determine effect Home Safety Toolkit intervention caregiver self-efficacy , caregiver adherence home safety recommendation , caregiver strain . Objective 2 : To determine effect Home Safety Toolkit intervention frequency risky behavior accident among care recipient dementia Alzheimer 's type living community . Research Design : This study single-blinded clinical trial random assignment subject either intervention group receive Home Safety Toolkit Intervention control group receive customary care . Methodology : The sample consist primary family caregiver person dementia Alzheimer 's type ( DAT ) receive care Bedford VAMC Dementia Outpatient Clinic , VA Boston HCS , Boston University Alzheimer 's Disease Center . Subjects dyads primary caregiver person progressive DAT live community , willing home visit home safety education , read speak English . Inclusion criterion care recipient : diagnosis DAT , score 24 less Mini-Mental State Exam ( MMSE ) , expect continue live community next 6 month , ability ambulate without help caregiver . Inclusion criterion primary informal caregiver : live home care-recipient , provide minimum 4 hour care-giving supervision per day , know cognitive impairment judge primary care provider refers subject dyad study recruitment . Exclusion criterion : care-recipient MMSE score 25 great ; previous home safety visit ; admission long-term care facility . Persons DAT live alone exclude safety issue complex primary informal caregiver make consistent observation risky behavior accident . Time 1 Time 2 data collection conduct home visit interim data collection do biweekly phone . A total 108 subject dyad complete study , randomly assign control group ( N-48 dyad ) intervention group ( 60 dydads ) . The length participation caregiver-care recipient dyad 3 month control group offer Home Safety Toolkit . Data analysis use Multivariate Analysis Covariance ( MANCOVA ) test hypotheses significant group difference follow outcome variable : adherence recommendation ; post-intervention caregiver self-efficacy post-intervention caregiver strain ; care-recipient risky behavior accident . Covariates include : baseline measure caregiver self-efficacy caregiver strain , caregiver year formal education use social support resource .
